snippet: The beleaguered retailer said sales fell 5 percent in the third quarter and losses grew as it reeled from the firing of its chief executive, Dov Charney, in June.
abstract: American Apparel reports third-quarter loss of $19.2 million, or 11 cents a share, compared with loss of $1.5 million in year-ago quarter; revenues were $155.9 million, compared with $164.5 million in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The beleaguered retailer said sales fell 5 percent in the third quarter and losses grew as it reeled from the firing of its chief executive, Dov Charney, in June.

headline.main: Investigation of Charney Adds to Loss at American Apparel
